guide.introduction:
A friend of mine recently said to me it is impossible to make a circle

on an etch-a-sketch and that set me thinking.

with gears, a transmission and a crank handle would it be possible to

rig some clockwork to turn the knobs on an etch-a-sketch so that they

make a complete circle?

I have been trying to work out the mechanics of it but am having some

difficulty.

A continuosly variable transmission would change the ratios of the two knobs to produce a quarter circle but there would then be a change in direction of the knobs to complete the circle.

I know I know i have far too much time on my hands but it would make for an interesting project!

Can you help please?
